intro: Tetraphyle lanceolata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf tetraphyle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy on the underside. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers in clusters during the late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and partial to full sunlight, making it suitable for garden cultivation. Its botanical interest lies in its unique leaf morphology and adaptability to various environmental conditions.
